member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.AllowedExtensions
member.summary: Specifies the extensions of the file types allowed in the uploader component and pass the extensions with comma separators. For example, if you want to upload specific image files, pass allowedExtensions as “.jpg,.png”.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.AsyncSettings
member.summary: Configures the save and remove URL to perform the upload operations in the server asynchronously.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.AutoUpload
member.summary: By default, the uploader component initiates automatic upload when the files are added in upload queue. If you want to manipulate the files before uploading to server, disable the autoUpload property. The buttons “upload” and “clear” will be hided from file list when autoUpload property is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.Buttons
member.summary: You can customize the default text of “browse, clear, and upload” buttons with plain text or HTML elements. The buttons’ text can be customized from localization also. If you configured both locale and buttons property, the uploader component considers the buttons property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with root element of the uploader. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a uploader.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.DirectoryUpload
member.summary: Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether the folder of files can be browsed in the uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.DropArea
member.summary: Specifies the drop target to handle the drag-and-drop upload. By default, the component creates wrapper around file input that will act as drop target.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies Boolean value that indicates whether the component is enabled or disabled. The uploader component does not allow to interact when this property is disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.Files
member.summary: Specifies the list of files that will be preloaded on rendering of uploader component. The property used to view and remove the uploaded files from server. By default, the files are configured with uploaded successfully state. The following properties are mandatory to configure the preload files: Name Size Type

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional html attributes such as disabled, value etc., to the element. If you configured both property and equivalent html attribute then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.MaxFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum allowed file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload too large files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.MinFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the minimum file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload empty files and small files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.Multiple
member.summary: Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether the multiple files can be browsed or dropped simultaneously in the uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.SequentialUpload
member.summary: By default, the file uploader component is processing the multiple files simultaneously. If sequentialUpload property is enabled, the file upload component performs the upload one after the other.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.ShowFileList
member.summary: Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether the default file list can be rendered. The property used to prevent default file list and design own template for file list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsUploader.Template

member.summary: Remove the uploaded file from server manually by calling the remove URL action. If you pass an empty argument to this method, the complete file list can be cleared, otherwise remove the specific file based on its argument (“file_data”).

member.summary: Allows you to call the upload process manually by calling save URL action. To process the selected files (added in upload queue), pass an empty argument otherwise upload the specific file based on its argument.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.ChunkSize
member.summary: Specifies the chunk size to split the large file into chunks, and upload it to the server in a sequential order. If the chunk size property has value, the uploader enables the chunk upload by default. It must be specified in bytes value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RemoveUrl
member.summary: Specifies the URL of remove action that receives the file information and handle the remove operation in server. The remove action type must be POST request and define “removeFileNames” attribute to get file information that will be removed. This property is optional.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RetryAfterDelay
member.summary: Specifies the delay time in milliseconds that the automatic retry happens after the delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RetryCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of retries that the uploader can perform on the file failed to upload. By default, the uploader set 3 as maximum retries. This property must be specified to prevent infinity looping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.SaveUrl
member.summary: Specifies the URL of save action that will receive the upload files and save in the server. The save action type must be POST request and define the argument as same input name used to render the component. The upload operations could not perform without this property.

member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.summary: Specifies boolean value that indicates whether the component is enabled or disabled. The Splitter component does not allow to interact when this property is disabled.

member.summary: Specifies the height of the Splitter component that accepts both string and number values.

member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Layouts.EjsSplitter.Orientation
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether to align the split panes horizontally or vertically. Set the orientation property as "Horizontal" to create a horizontal splitter that aligns the panes left-to-right. Set the orientation property as "Vertical" to create a vertical splitter that aligns the panes top-to-bottom.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Layouts.EjsSplitter.PaneSettings
member.summary: Configures the individual pane behaviors such as content, size, resizable, minimum, maximum validation, collapsible and collapsed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Layouts.EjsSplitter.SeparatorSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of the separator line for both horizontal or vertical orientation. The separator is used to separate the panes by lines.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Layouts.EjsSplitter.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Splitter control, which accepts both string and number values as width. The string value can be either in pixel or percentage format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.Min
member.summary: Specifies the minimum size of a pane. The pane cannot be resized if it is less than the specified minimum size.

member.summary: Specifies whether the Sidebar need to be closed or not when document area is clicked.

member.summary: Specifies the size of the Sidebar in dock state. > For more details about dockSize refer to [`Dock`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/docking-sidebar/) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.EnableDock
member.summary: Specifies the docking state of the component. > For more details about enableDock refer to [`Dock`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/docking-sidebar/) documentation.

member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. Position 2. Type

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.EnableRtl
member.summary: Specifies the Sidebar in RTL mode that displays the content in the right-to-left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.IsOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets the Sidebar component is open or close. > When the Sidebar type is set to `Auto`, the component will be expanded in the desktop and collapsed in the mobile mode regardless of the isOpen property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.MediaQuery
member.summary:
Specifies the media query string for resolution, which when met opens the Sidebar.
> For more details about mediaQuery refer to [`Auto Close`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/auto-close/) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.Position
member.summary: Specifies the position of the Sidebar (Left/Right) corresponding to the main content. > For more details about SidebarPosition refer to [`position`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/getting-started/#position) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.ShowBackdrop
member.summary: Specifies the whether to apply overlay options to main content when the Sidebar is in an open state. > For more details about showBackdrop refer to [`Backdrop`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/getting-started/#enable-backdrop) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.Target
member.summary: Allows to place the sidebar inside the target element. > For more details about target refer to [`Custom Context`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/custom-context/) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.Type
member.summary: Specifies the expanding types of the Sidebar. `Over` - The sidebar floats over the main content area. `Push` - The sidebar pushes the main content area to appear side-by-side, and shrinks the main content within the screen width. `Slide` - The sidebar translates the x and y positions of main content area based on the sidebar width. The main content area will not be adjusted within the screen width. `Auto` - Sidebar with `Over` type in mobile resolution and `Push` type in other higher resolutions. > For more details about SidebarType refer to [`SidebarType`](./variations.html#types) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Sidebar. By default, the width of the Sidebar sets based on the size of its content. Width can also be set in pixel values.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.ZIndex
member.summary: Specifies the z-index of the Sidebar. It is applicable only when sidebar act as overlay type.

member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. selectedItem

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.HeaderPlacement
member.summary: Specifies the orientation of Tab header. The possible values are: - Top: Places the Tab header on the top. - Bottom: Places the Tab header at the bottom. - Left: Places the Tab header on the left. - Right: Places the Tab header at the right.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the Tab component. By default, Tab height is set based on the height of its parent. To use height property, heightAdjustMode must be set to 'None'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.HeightAdjustMode
member.summary: Specifies the height style for Tab content. The possible values are: - None: Based on the given height property, the content panel height is set. - Auto: Tallest panel height of a given Tab content is set to all the other panels. - Content: Based on the corresponding content height, the content panel height is set. - Fill: Based on the parent height, the content panel height is set.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.Items
member.summary: An array of object that is used to configure the Tab component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the Tab display mode when Tab content exceeds the viewing area. The possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements are displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Tab container holds the items that can be placed within the available space and rest of the items are moved to the popup. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements can be viewed by scrolling the popup.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.SelectedItem
member.summary: Specifies the index for activating the current Tab item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.ShowCloseButton
member.summary: Specifies whether to show the close button for header items to remove the item from the Tab.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Tab component. Default, Tab width sets based on the width of its parent.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.Added
member.summary: The event will be fired after adding the item to the Tab.

member.summary: The event will be fired before adding the item to the Tab.

member.summary: The event will be fired before removing the item from the Tab.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.Selecting
member.summary: The event will be fired before the item gets selected.

member.summary: Specifies the value to disable/enable the Tab component. When set to `true`, the component will be disabled.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.EnableTab(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables the specified Tab item. On passing value as `false`, the item will be disabled.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.HideTab(System.Double,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Shows or hides the Tab that is in the specified index.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.RemoveTab(System.Double)
member.summary: Removes the items in the Tab from the specified index.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.Select(System.Object)
member.summary: Specifies the index or HTMLElement to select an item from the Tab.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the Toolbar in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.Items
member.summary: An array of items that is used to configure Toolbar commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar display mode when Toolbar content exceeds the viewing area. Possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements are displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Prioritized elements are displayed on the Toolbar and the rest of elements are moved to the popup. - MultiRow: Displays the overflow toolbar items as an in-line of a toolbar. - Extended: Hide the overflowing toolbar items in the next row. Show the overflowing toolbar items when you click the expand icons. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements will be hidden.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toolbar in pixels/numbers/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.OnCreate
member.summary: The event will be fired before the control is rendered on a page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.Clicked
member.summary: The event will be fired on clicking the Toolbar elements.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.Created
member.summary: The event will be fired when the control is rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.Destroyed
member.summary: The event will be fired when the control gets destroyed.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.AddItems(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Adds new items to the Toolbar that accepts an array as Toolbar items.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.Disable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies the value to disable/enable the Toolbar component. When set to `true`, the component will be disabled.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.EnableItems(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Enables or disables the specified Toolbar item.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.HideItem(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Shows or hides the Toolbar item that is in the specified index.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.RefreshOverflow
member.summary: Refresh the whole Toolbar component without re-rendering. - It is used to manually refresh the Toolbar overflow modes such as scrollable, popup, multi row, and extended. - It will refresh the Toolbar component after loading items dynamically.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.RemoveItems(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the items from the Toolbar. Acceptable arguments are index of item/HTMLElement/node list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.AllowDragAndDrop
member.summary: Indicates whether the TreeView allows drag and drop of nodes. To drag and drop a node in desktop, hold the mouse on the node, drag it to the target node and drop the node by releasing the mouse. For touch devices, drag and drop operation is performed by touch, touch move and touch end. For more information on drag and drop nodes concept, refer to [Drag and Drop](../../treeview/drag-and-drop/).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.AllowEditing
member.summary: Enables or disables editing of the text in the TreeView node. When `allowEditing` property is set to true, the TreeView allows you to edit the node by double clicking the node or by navigating to the node and pressing F2 key. For more information on node editing, refer to [Node Editing](../../treeview/node-editing/).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.AllowMultiSelection
member.summary: Enables or disables multi-selection of nodes. To select multiple nodes: Select the nodes by holding down the CTRL key while clicking on the nodes. Select consecutive nodes by clicking the first node to select and hold down the SHIFT key and click the last node to select.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.Animation
member.summary: Specifies the type of animation applied on expanding and collapsing the nodes along with duration.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.AutoCheck
member.summary: Allow us to specify the parent and child nodes to get auto check while we check or uncheck a node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.CheckedNodes
member.summary: The `checkedNodes` property is used to set the nodes that need to be checked or get the ID of nodes that are currently checked in the TreeView component. The `checkedNodes` property depends upon the value of `showCheckBox` property. For more information on checkedNodes, refer to [checkedNodes](../../treeview/check-box#checked-nodes).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS classes to be added with root element of the TreeView to help customize the appearance of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enables or disables persisting TreeView state between page reloads. If enabled, following APIs will persist. 1. `selectedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are selected in the TreeView component. 2. `checkedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are checked in the TreeView component. 3. `expandedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are expanded in the TreeView component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.ExpandOn
member.summary: Specifies the action on which the node expands or collapses. The available actions are, `Auto` - In desktop, the expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node, and in mobile devices it happens on single-click. `Click` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you single-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `DblClick` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `None` - The expand/collapse operation will not happen when you single-click or double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.ExpandedNodes
member.summary: Represents the expanded nodes in the TreeView component. We can set the nodes that need to be expanded or get the ID of the nodes that are currently expanded by using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.Fields
member.summary: Specifies the data source and mapping fields to render TreeView nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.FullRowSelect
member.summary: On enabling this property, the entire row of the TreeView node gets selected by clicking a node. When disabled only the corresponding node's text gets selected. For more information on Fields concept, refer to [Fields](../../treeview/data-binding#local-data).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.LoadOnDemand
member.summary: By default, the load on demand (Lazy load) is set to true. By disabling this property, all the tree nodes are rendered at the beginning itself.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.NodeTemplate
member.summary: Specifies a template to render customized content for all the nodes. If the `nodeTemplate` property is set, the template content overrides the displayed node text. The property accepts template string [template string](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/base/template-engine.html) or HTML element ID holding the content. For more information on template concept, refer to [Template](../../treeview/template/).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.SelectedNodes
member.summary: Represents the selected nodes in the TreeView component. We can set the nodes that need to be selected or get the ID of the nodes that are currently selected by using this property. On enabling `allowMultiSelection` property we can select multiple nodes and on disabling it we can select only a single node. For more information on selectedNodes, refer to [selectedNodes](../../treeview/multiple-selection#selected-nodes).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.ShowCheckBox
member.summary: Indicates that the nodes will display CheckBoxes in the TreeView. The CheckBox will be displayed next to the expand/collapse icon of the node. For more information on CheckBoxes, refer to [CheckBox](../../treeview/check-box/).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.SortOrder
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the nodes are sorted in the ascending or descending order, or are not sorted at all. The available types of sort order are, `None` - The nodes are not sorted. `Ascending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order. `Descending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.Created
member.summary: Triggers when the TreeView control is created successfully.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.DataBound
member.summary: Triggers when data source is populated in the TreeView.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.DataSourceChanged
member.summary: Triggers when data source is changed in the TreeView. The data source will be changed after performing some operation like drag and drop, node editing, adding and removing node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.Destroyed
member.summary: Triggers when the TreeView control is destroyed successfully.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.OnDrawNode
member.summary: Triggers before the TreeView node is appended to the TreeView element. It helps to customize specific nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.OnKeyPress
member.summary: Triggers when key press is successful. It helps to customize the operations at key press.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.OnNodeDragStart
member.summary: Triggers when the TreeView node drag (move) starts.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.OnNodeDragged
member.summary: Triggers when the TreeView node drag (move) is stopped.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.NodeDropped
member.summary: Triggers when the TreeView node is dropped on target element successfully.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.NodeEdited
member.summary: Triggers when the TreeView node is renamed successfully.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.NodeEditing
member.summary: Triggers before the TreeView node is renamed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.NodeSelected
member.summary: Triggers when the TreeView node is selected/unselected successfully.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.AddNodes(System.Object,System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Adds the collection of TreeView nodes based on target and index position. If target node is not specified, then the nodes are added as children of the given parentID or in the root level of TreeView.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.BeginEdit(System.Object)
member.summary: Instead of clicking on the TreeView node for editing, we can enable it by using `beginEdit` property. On passing the node ID or element through this property, the edit textBox will be created for the particular node thus allowing us to edit it.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.CheckAll(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks all the unchecked nodes. You can also check specific nodes by passing array of unchecked nodes as argument to this method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.CollapseAll(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Collapses all the expanded TreeView nodes. You can collapse specific nodes by passing array of nodes as argument to this method. You can also collapse all the nodes excluding the hidden nodes by setting excludeHiddenNodes to true. If you want to collapse a specific level of nodes, set level as argument to collapseAll method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.DisableNodes(System.Object)
member.summary: Disables the collection of nodes by passing the ID of nodes or node elements in the array.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.EnableNodes(System.Object)
member.summary: Enables the collection of disabled nodes by passing the ID of nodes or node elements in the array.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.EnsureVisible(System.Object)
member.summary: Ensures visibility of the TreeView node by using node ID or node element. When many TreeView nodes are present and we need to find a particular node, `ensureVisible` property helps bring the node to visibility by expanding the TreeView and scrolling to the specific node.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.ExpandAll(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Expands all the collapsed TreeView nodes. You can expand the specific nodes by passing the array of collapsed nodes as argument to this method. You can also expand all the collapsed nodes by excluding the hidden nodes by setting excludeHiddenNodes to true to this method. To expand a specific level of nodes, set level as argument to expandAll method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.GetAllCheckedNodes
member.summary: Gets all the checked nodes including child, whether it is loaded or not.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.GetNode(System.Object)
member.summary: Get the node's data such as id, text, parentID, selected, isChecked, and expanded by passing the node element or it's ID.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.GetTreeData(System.Object)
member.summary: To get the updated data source of TreeView after performing some operation like drag and drop, node editing, node selecting/unSelecting, node expanding/collapsing, node checking/unChecking, adding and removing node. If you pass the ID of TreeView node as arguments for this method then it will return the updated data source of the corresponding node otherwise it will return the entire updated data source of TreeView. The updated data source also contains custom attributes if you specified in data source.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.MoveNodes(System.Object,System.Object,System.Double,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Moves the collection of nodes within the same TreeView based on target or its index position.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.RemoveNodes(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the collection of TreeView nodes by passing the array of node details as argument to this method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.UncheckAll(System.Object)
member.summary: Unchecks all the checked nodes. You can also uncheck the specific nodes by passing array of checked nodes as argument to this method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView.UpdateNode(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces the text of the TreeView node with the given text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuAnimationSettings.Duration
member.summary: Specifies the time duration to transform object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuAnimationSettings.Easing
member.summary: Specifies the easing effect applied while transform.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuAnimationSettings.Effect
member.summary: Specifies the effect that shown in the sub menu transform. The possible effects are: None: Specifies the sub menu transform with no animation effect. SlideDown: Specifies the sub menu transform with slide down effect. ZoomIn: Specifies the sub menu transform with zoom in effect. FadeIn: Specifies the sub menu transform with fade in effect.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuFieldSettings.Children
member.summary: Specifies the children field for Menu item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuFieldSettings.IconCss
member.summary: Specifies the css icon field for Menu item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuFieldSettings.ItemId
member.summary: Specifies the itemId field for Menu item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuFieldSettings.ParentId
member.summary: Specifies the parentId field for Menu item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuFieldSettings.Separator
member.summary: Specifies the separator field for Menu item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuFieldSettings.Text
member.summary: Specifies the text field for Menu item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuFieldSettings.Url
member.summary: Specifies the Url field for Menu item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuItem.IconCss
member.summary: Defines class/multiple classes separated by a space for the menu Item that is used to include an icon. Menu Item can include font icon and sprite image.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuItem.Id
member.summary: Specifies the id for menu item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuItem.Items
member.summary: Specifies the sub menu items that is the array of MenuItem model.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuItem.Separator
member.summary: Specifies separator between the menu items. Separator are either horizontal or vertical lines used to group menu items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuItem.Text
member.summary: Specifies text for menu item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.MenuItem.Url
member.summary: Specifies url for menu item that creates the anchor link to navigate to the url provided.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabAnimationSettings.Next
member.summary: Specifies the animation to appear while moving to next Tab content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabAnimationSettings.Previous
member.summary: Specifies the animation to appear while moving to previous Tab content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabHeader.IconCss
member.summary: Specifies the icon class that is used to render an icon in the Tab header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabHeader.IconPosition
member.summary: Options for positioning the icon in the Tab item header. This property depends on `iconCss` property. The possible values are: - Left: Places the icon to the `left` of the item. - Top: Places the icon on the `top` of the item. - Right: Places the icon to the `right` end of the item. - Bottom: Places the icon at the `bottom` of the item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabHeader.Text
member.summary: Specifies the display text of the Tab item header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabItem.Content
member.summary: Specifies the content of Tab item, that is displayed when concern item header is selected.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabItem.CssClass
member.summary: Sets the CSS classes to the Tab item to customize its styles.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabItem.Disabled
member.summary: Sets true to disable user interactions of the Tab item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabItem.Header
member.summary: The object used for configuring the Tab item header properties.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Align
member.summary: Specifies the location for aligning Toolbar items on the Toolbar. Each command will be aligned according to the `align` property. Possible values are: - Left: To align commands to the left side of the Toolbar. - Center: To align commands at the center of the Toolbar. - Right: To align commands to the right side of the Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.CssClass
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes (separated by space) to be used for customization of commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Defines htmlAttributes used to add custom attributes to Toolbar command. Supports HTML attributes such as style, class, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Id
member.summary: Specifies the unique ID to be used with button or input element of Toolbar items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Overflow
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar command display area when an element's content is too large to fit available space. This is applicable only to `popup` mode. Possible values are: - Show: Always shows the item as the primary priority on the Toolbar. - Hide: Always shows the item as the secondary priority on the popup. - None: No priority for display, and as per normal order moves to popup when content exceeds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.PrefixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned before the text content if text is available, otherwise the icon alone will be rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ShowAlwaysInPopup
member.summary: Defines the priority of items to display it in popup always. It allows to maintain toolbar item on popup always but it does not work for toolbar priority items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ShowTextOn
member.summary: Specifies where the button text will be displayed on popup mode of the Toolbar. Possible values are: - Toolbar: Text will be displayed on Toolbar only. - Overflow: Text will be displayed only when content overflows to popup. - Both: Text will be displayed on popup and Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.SuffixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned after the text content if text is available.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML element/element ID as a string that can be added as a Toolbar command.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Text
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.TooltipText
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Type
member.summary: Specifies the types of command to be rendered in the Toolbar. Supported types are: - Button: Creates the Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc. - Separator: Adds a horizontal line that separates the Toolbar commands. - Input: Creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toolbar button commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Notifications.EjsToast.NewestOnTop

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Notifications.EjsToast.Position
member.summary: Specifies the position of the Toast message to be displayed within target container. In the case of multiple Toast display, new Toast position will not update on dynamic change of property values until the old Toast messages removed. X values are: Left , Right ,Center Y values are: Top , Bottom

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Notifications.EjsToast.ShowCloseButton
member.summary: Specifies whether to show the close button in Toast message to close the Toast.

member.summary: Specifies whether to show the progress bar to denote the Toast message display timeout.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Notifications.EjsToast.Target
member.summary: Specifies the target container where the Toast to be displayed. Based on the target, the positions such as `Left`, `Top` will be applied to the Toast. The default value is null, which refers the `document.body` element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Notifications.EjsToast.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML element/element ID as a string that can be displayed as a Toast. The given template is taken as preference to render the Toast, even if the built-in properties such as title and content are defined.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Notifications.EjsToast.TimeOut
member.summary: Specifies the Toast display time duration on the page in milliseconds. - Once the time expires, Toast message will be removed. - Setting 0 as a time out value displays the Toast on the page until the user closes it manually.

member.summary: Specifies the title to be displayed on the Toast.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Notifications.EjsToast.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toast in pixels/numbers/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels. In mobile devices, default width is considered as `100%`.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.Sorting
member.summary: Defines directions of Sorting. They are Ascending Descending None

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.SummaryTypes
member.summary: Defines the aggregate types.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.FilterType
member.summary: Defines types of Filter Include - Specifies the filter type as include. Exclude - Specifies the filter type as exclude. Label - Specifies the filter type as label. Date - Specifies the filter type as date. Number - Specifies the filter type as number. Value - Specifies the filter type as value.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotCellSelectionMode
member.summary: Defines mode of cell selection. Flow Box

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.Mode
member.summary: Defines mode of render. They are Fixed Popup

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.DateGroup
member.summary: Defines group of date field Years - Specifies the group as years. Quarters - Specifies the group as quarters. Months - Specifies the group as months. Days - Specifies the group as days. Hours - Specifies the group as hours. Minutes - Specifies the group as minutes. Seconds - Specifies the group as seconds.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartAlignment
member.summary: Defines the Alignment. They are near - Align the element to the left. center - Align the element to the center. far - Align the element to the right.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartAnchor
member.summary: Defines the strip line text position. Start - Places the strip line text at the start. Middle - Places the strip line text in the middle. End - Places the strip line text at the end.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartAxisPosition
member.summary: Defines the Position. They are inside - Place the ticks or labels inside to the axis line. outside - Place the ticks or labels outside to the axis line.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartBorderType
member.summary: Defines border type for multi level labels. Rectangle Brace WithoutBorder Without top Border Without top and bottom border Curly brace

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartDrawType
member.summary: Type of series to be drawn in radar or polar series. They are line - Renders the line series. column - Renders the column series. area - Renders the area series. scatter - Renders the scatter series. spline - Renders the spline series. stackingColumn - Renders the stacking column series. stackingArea - Renders the stacking area series. rangeColumn - Renders the range column series. splineArea - Renders the spline area series.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartEdgeLabelPlacement
member.summary: Defines the Edge Label Placement for an axis. They are none - No action will be perform. hide - Edge label will be hidden. shift - Shift the edge labels.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartEmptyPointMode
member.summary: Defines the empty point mode of the chart. Gap - Used to display empty points as space. Zero - Used to display empty points as zero. Drop - Used to ignore the empty point while rendering. Average - Used to display empty points as previous and next point average.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartErrorBarDirection
member.summary: Defines the direction of error bar. They are both - Renders both direction of error bar. minus - Renders minus direction of error bar. plus - Renders plus direction error bar.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartErrorBarMode
member.summary: Defines the modes of error bar. They are vertical - Renders a vertical error bar. horizontal - Renders a horizontal error bar. both - Renders both side error bar.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartErrorBarType
member.summary: Defines the type of error bar. They are fixed - Renders a fixed type error bar. percentage - Renders a percentage type error bar. standardDeviation - Renders a standard deviation type error bar. standardError -Renders a standard error type error bar. custom -Renders a custom type error bar.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartLabelIntersectAction
member.summary: Defines the Alignment. They are none - Shows all the labels. hide - Hide the label when it intersect. rotate45 - Rotate the label to 45 degree when it intersect. rotate90 - Rotate the label to 90 degree when it intersect.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartLabelPlacement
member.summary: Defines the Label Placement for category axis. They are betweenTicks - Render the label between the ticks. onTicks - Render the label on the ticks.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartLegendPosition
member.summary: Defines the position of the legend. They are auto - Places the legend based on area type. top - Displays the legend on the top of chart. left - Displays the legend on the left of chart. bottom - Displays the legend on the bottom of chart. right - Displays the legend on the right of chart. custom - Displays the legend based on given x and y value.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartLegendShape
member.summary: Defines the shape of legend. They are circle - Renders a circle. rectangle - Renders a rectangle. triangle - Renders a triangle. diamond - Renders a diamond. cross - Renders a cross. horizontalLine - Renders a horizontalLine. verticalLine - Renders a verticalLine. pentagon - Renders a pentagon. invertedTriangle - Renders a invertedTriangle. SeriesType -Render a legend shape based on series type.

member.summary: Defines the shape of marker. member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartTheme
member.summary: Defines Theme of the chart. They are Material - Render a chart with Material theme. Fabric - Render a chart with Fabric theme

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartToolbarItems
member.summary: Defines the ZoomingToolkit, They are. zoom - Renders the zoom button. zoomIn - Renders the zoomIn button. zoomOut - Renders the zoomOut button. pan - Renders the pan button. reset - Renders the reset button.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartTrendlineTypes
member.summary: Defines the type of trendlines. They are Linear - Defines the linear trendline Exponential - Defines the exponential trendline Polynomial - Defines the polynomial trendline Power - Defines the power trendline Logarithmic - Defines the logarithmic trendline MovingAverage - Defines the moving average trendline

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartZIndex
member.summary: Specifies the order of the strip line. `Over` | `Behind`. Over - Places the strip line over the series elements. Behind - laces the strip line behind the series elements.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotChartZoomMode
member.summary: Defines the zooming mode, They are. x,y - Chart will be zoomed with respect to both vertical and horizontal axis. x - Chart will be zoomed with respect to horizontal axis. y - Chart will be zoomed with respect to vertical axis.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotCheckboxSelectionType
member.summary: Defines modes of checkbox Selection. They are Default ResetOnRowClick

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotClipMode
member.summary: Defines the cell content's overflow mode. The available modes are `Clip` - Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area. `Ellipsis` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area. `EllipsisWithTooltip` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area also it will display tooltip while hover on ellipsis applied cell.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotContextMenuItem

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewGridSettings.AllowReordering
member.summary: If `allowReordering` is set to true, Grid columns can be reordered. Reordering can be done by drag and drop of a particular column from one index to another index. > If Grid is rendered with stacked headers, reordering is allowed only at the same level as the column headers.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewGridSettings.AllowResizing
member.summary: If `allowResizing` is set to true, Grid columns can be resized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewGridSettings.AllowSelection
member.summary: If `allowSelection` is set to true, it allows selection of (highlight row) Grid records by clicking it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewGridSettings.AllowTextWrap
member.summary: If `allowTextWrap` set to true, then text content will wrap to the next line when its text content exceeds the width of the Column Cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewGridSettings.ClipMode
member.summary: Defines the cell content's overflow mode. The available modes are `Clip` - Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area. `Ellipsis` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area. `EllipsisWithTooltip` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area also it will display tooltip while hover on ellipsis applied cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewGridSettings.ColumnWidth
member.summary: Defines the height of Grid rows.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewGridSettings.ContextMenuItems
member.summary: `contextMenuItems` defines both built-in and custom context menu items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewGridSettings.GridLines
member.summary: Defines the mode of grid lines. The available modes are, `Both`: Displays both horizontal and vertical grid lines. `None`: No grid lines are displayed. `Horizontal`: Displays the horizontal grid lines only. `Vertical`: Displays the vertical grid lines only. `Default`: Displays grid lines based on the theme.

The available types are, `Sum`: The summary cells calculated by the sum of its cells. `Count`: The summary cells calculated by the count of its cells. `Min`: The summary cells shows the value which is the minimum value of its cells. `Max`: The summary cells shows the value which is the maximum value of its cells. `Percentage`: The summary cells displays in percentage format. `Avg`: The summary cells calculated by the average of its cells. `CalculatedField`: It should set to include calculated fields.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewSelectionSettings.CellSelectionMode
member.summary: The cell selection modes are flow and box. It requires the selection `mode` to be either cell or both. `Flow`: Selects the range of cells between start index and end index that also includes the other cells of the selected rows. `Box`: Selects the range of cells within the start and end column indexes that includes in between cells of rows within the range. `BoxWithBorder`: Selects the range of cells as like Box mode with borders.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewSelectionSettings.CheckboxMode
member.summary: Defines options for checkbox selection Mode. They are `Default`: This is the default value of the checkboxMode. In this mode, user can select multiple rows by clicking rows one by one. `ResetOnRowClick`: In ResetOnRowClick mode, on clicking a row it will reset previously selected row and also multiple rows can be selected by using CTRL or SHIFT key.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewSelectionSettings.CheckboxOnly
member.summary: If 'checkboxOnly' set to true, then the selection is allowed only through checkbox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewSelectionSettings.EnableSimpleMultiRowSelection
member.summary: If 'enableSimpleMultiRowSelection' set to true, then the user can able to perform multiple row selection with single clicks.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewSelectionSettings.Mode
member.summary: Pivot widget supports row, column, cell, and both (row and column) selection mode.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewSelectionSettings.PersistSelection
member.summary: If 'persistSelection' set to true, then the selection is persisted on all operations. For persisting selection, any one of the column should be enabled as a primary key.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.PivotView.PivotViewSelectionSettings.Type
member.summary: Defines options for selection type. They are `Single`: Allows selection of only a row or a column or a cell. `Multiple`: Allows selection of multiple rows or columns or cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Effect
member.summary: Specifies the animation name that should be applied on open and close the dialog. If user sets Fade animation, the dialog will open with `FadeIn` effect and close with `FadeOut` effect. The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the dialog: 1. Fade 2. FadeZoom 3. FlipLeftDown 4. FlipLeftUp 5. FlipRightDown 6. FlipRightUp 7. FlipXDown 8. FlipXUp 9. FlipYLeft 10. FlipYRight 11. SlideBottom 12. SlideLeft 13. SlideRight 14. SlideTop 15. Zoom 16. None

member.summary: Specifies the boolean value whether the dialog can be closed with the escape key that is used to control the dialog's closing behavior.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.Content
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in dialog's content area. It can be information, list, or other HTML elements. The content of dialog can be loaded with dynamic data such as database, AJAX content, and more.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with root element of the dialog. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.EnableResize
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be resized by the end-user. If enableResize is true, the dialog component creates grip to resize it diagonal direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the template value that can be displayed with dialog's footer area. This is optional property and can be used only when the footer is occupied with information or custom components. By default, the footer is configured with action [buttons](#buttons). If footer template is configured to dialog, the action buttons property will be disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.Header
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's title area that can be configured with plain text or HTML elements. This is optional property and the dialog can be displayed without header, if the header property is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the dialog component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.IsModal
member.summary: Specifies the Boolean value whether the dialog can be displayed as modal or non-modal. `Modal`: It creates overlay that disable interaction with the parent application and user should respond with modal before continuing with other applications. `Modeless`: It does not prevent user interaction with parent application.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.Position
member.summary: Specifies the value where the dialog can be positioned within the document or target. The position can be represented with pre-configured positions or specific X and Y values. `X value`: left, center, right, or offset value. `Y value`: top, center, bottom, or offset value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.ShowCloseIcon

member.summary: Specifies the width of the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.Animation
member.summary: We can set the same or different animation option to Tooltip while it is in open or close state. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/animation.html?lang=typescript) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.CloseDelay
member.summary: It is used to close the Tooltip after a specified delay in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.Content
member.summary: It is used to display the content of Tooltip which can be both string and HTML Elements. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/content.html?lang=typescript) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.CssClass
member.summary: It is used to customize the Tooltip which accepts custom CSS class names that defines specific user-defined styles and themes to be applied on the Tooltip element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.Height
member.summary: It is used to set the height of Tooltip component which accepts both string and number values. When Tooltip content gets overflow due to height value then the scroll mode will be enabled. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/setting-dimension.html?lang=typescript) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.IsSticky
member.summary: It is used to display the Tooltip in an open state until closed by manually. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/open-mode.html?lang=typescript#sticky-mode) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.MouseTrail
member.summary: It allows the Tooltip to follow the mouse pointer movement over the specified target element. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/position.html?lang=typescript#mouse-trailing) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.OffsetX
member.summary: It sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in X axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.OffsetY
member.summary: It sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in Y axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.OpenDelay
member.summary: It is used to open the Tooltip after the specified delay in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.OpensOn
member.summary: It is used to determine the device mode to display the Tooltip content. If it is in desktop, it will show the Tooltip content when hovering on the target element. If it is in touch device, it will show the Tooltip content when tap and holding on the target element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.Position
member.summary: It is used to set the position of Tooltip element, with respect to Target element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.ShowTipPointer
member.summary: It is used to show or hide the tip pointer of Tooltip.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.Target
member.summary: It is used to denote the target selector where the Tooltip need to be displayed. The target element is considered as parent container.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.TipPointerPosition
member.summary: It is used to set the position of tip pointer on tooltip. When it sets to auto, the tip pointer auto adjusts within the space of target's length and does not point outside. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/position.html?lang=typescript#tip-pointer-positioning) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.Width
member.summary: It is used to set the width of Tooltip component which accepts both string and number values. When set to auto, the Tooltip width gets auto adjusted to display its content within the viewable screen.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.Closed
member.summary: We can trigger `afterClose` event when the Tooltip Component gets closed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.Opened
member.summary: We can trigger `afterOpen` event after the Tooltip Component gets opened.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.OnClose
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeClose` event before the Tooltip hides from the screen. If returned false, then the Tooltip is no more hidden.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.OnCollision
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeCollision` event for every collision fit calculation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.OnOpen
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeOpen` event before the Tooltip is displayed over the target element. When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip display can be prevented. This event is mainly used for the purpose of refreshing the Tooltip positions dynamically or to set customized styles in it and so on.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.OnRender
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeRender` event before the Tooltip and its contents are added to the DOM. When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip can be prevented from rendering on the page. This event is mainly used for the purpose of customizing the Tooltip before it shows up on the screen. For example, to load the AJAX content or to set new animation effects on the Tooltip, this event can be opted. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/content.html?lang=typescript#dynamic-content-via-ajax) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.Created
member.summary: We can trigger `created` event after the Tooltip component is created.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.Destroyed
member.summary: We can trigger `destroyed` event when the Tooltip component is destroyed.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.Close(System.Object)
member.summary: It is used to hide the Tooltip with specific animation effect.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsTooltip.Open(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: It is used to show the Tooltip on the specified target with specific animation settings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.IframeSettings
member.summary: Specifies the items to be rendered in an iframe mode, and it has the following properties. enable - Set Boolean value to enable, the editors content is placed in an iframe and isolated from the rest of the page. attributes - Custom style to be used inside the iframe to display content. This style is added to the iframe body. resources - we can add both styles and scripts to the iframe. 1. styles[] - An array of CSS style files to inject inside the iframe to display content 2. scripts[] - An array of JS script files to inject inside the iframe

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.InlineMode
member.summary: Enable or disable the inline edit mode. enable - set boolean value to enable or disable the inline edit mode. onSelection - If its set to true, upon selecting the text, the toolbar is opened in inline. If its set to false, upon clicking to the target element, the toolbar is opened.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.InsertImageSettings
member.summary: Specifies the image insert options in RichTextEditor component and control with the following properties. allowedTypes - Specifies the extensions of the image types allowed to insert on bowering and passing the extensions with comma separators. For example, pass allowedTypes as .jpg and .png. display - Sets the default display for an image when it is inserted in to the RichTextEditor. Possible options are: 'inline' and 'block'. width - Sets the default width of the image when it is inserted in the RichTextEditor. height - Sets the default height of the image when it is inserted in the RichTextEditor. saveUrl - Provides URL to map the action result method to save the image. path - Specifies the location to store the image.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.KeyConfig
member.summary: Customizes the key actions in RichTextEditor. For example, when using German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.MaxLength
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of characters allowed in the RichTextEditor component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.PasteCleanupSettings
member.summary: Specifies the pasting options in RichTextEditor component and control with the following properties. prompt - Set boolean value to enable or disable the prompt when pasting. deniedAttrs - Specifies the attributes to restrict when pasting in RTE. allowedStyleProps - Specifies the allowed style properties when pasting in RTE. deniedTags - Specifies the tags to restrict when pasting in RTE. keepFormat - Set boolean value to keep or remove the from when pasting. plainText - Set boolean value to paste as plain text or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.Placeholder
member.summary: Specifies the placeholder for the RichTextEditor’s content used when the RichTextEditor body is empty.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.QuickToolbarSettings
member.summary: Specifies the items to be rendered in quick toolbar based on the target element. It has following fields: enable - set boolean value to show or hide the quick toolbar actionOnScroll - it has two possible options 1. hide: The quickToolbar is closed when the parent element is scrolled. 2. none: The quickToolbar cannot be closed even the parent element is scrolled. link - Specifies the items to be rendered in quick toolbar based on link element such as `Open`, `Edit`, and `UnLink`. image - Specifies the items to be rendered in quick toolbar based on image element such as 'Replace', 'Align', 'Caption', 'Remove', 'InsertLink', 'Display', 'AltText', 'Dimension'. text - Specifies the items to be rendered in quick toolbar based on text element such as 'Cut', 'Copy', 'Paste'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.Readonly
member.summary: The user interactions on the component are disabled, when set to true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.SaveInterval
member.summary: Specifies the saveInterval in milliseconds for autosave the value. The change event will be triggered if the content was changed from the last saved interval.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.ShowCharCount
member.summary: Sets Boolean value to enable or disable the display of the character counter.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.TableSettings
member.summary: Specifies the table insert options in RichTextEditor component and control with the following properties. styles - Class name should be appended by default in table element. It helps to design the table in specific CSS styles always when inserting in editor. width - Sets the default width of the table when it is inserted in the RichTextEditor. minWidth - Sets the default minWidth of the table when it is inserted in the RichTextEditor. maxWidth - Sets the default maxWidth of the table when it is inserted in the RichTextEditor. resize - To enable resize the table.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.ToolbarSettings
member.summary: Specifies the group of items aligned horizontally in the toolbar as well as defined the toolbar rendering type. By default, toolbar is float at the top of the RichTextEditor. When you scroll down, the toolbar will scroll along with the page on RichTextEditor with the specified offset value. enable: set boolean value to show or hide the toolbar. enableFloating: Set Boolean value to enable or disable the floating toolbar. Preserves the toolbar at top of the RichTextEditor on scrolling. type: it has two possible options 1. Expand: Hide the overflowing toolbar items in the next row. Click the expand arrow to view overflowing toolbar items 2. MultiRow: The toolbar overflowing items wrapped in the next row. items: Specifies the array of items aligned horizontally in the toolbar. > | and - can insert a vertical and horizontal separator lines in the toolbar. itemConfigs: Modify the default toolbar item configuration like icon class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.UndoRedoSteps
member.summary: Specifies the count of undo history which is stored in undoRedoManager.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.UndoRedoTimer
member.summary: Specifies the interval value in milliseconds that store actions in undoRedoManager. The minimum value is 300 milliseconds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.RichTextEditor.EjsRichTextEditor.Value
member.summary: Specifies the value displayed in the RichTextEditor's content area and it should be string. The content of RichTextEditor can be loaded with dynamic data such as database, AJAX content, and more.
